description: Students examine American families through the life cycle in relation to personal and professional
life, with the major emphasis on communication and commitment in interpersonal relationships.
Students study courtship, marriage, adjustment to parenthood, and examine stressors that affect
families such as family violence, divorce, grief and loss, and socioeconomic issues.  This course
takes an interdisciplinary approach; students have opportunity for a broad range of individualized
study. Offered annually during the fall semester. Counts towards American studies major.
